title.narrative: Support for Resilience capacity building for CTP South Sudan team and partners

description.narrative: There is a growing shift and focus from donors in South Sudan to integrated, multiyear programming, focused on building resilience. Resilience building, is a complex process that involves a variety of stakeholders and overlaps with different sectors in both humanitarian and development contexts. As Resilience encompasses different sectors, it is important for agency and partner staff to understand how resilience fits into both current and future programming. Therefore, the need exists to build capacity of key personnel in South Sudan to be able to develop and implement impactful and transformative resilience programmes. The South Sudan programme is currently in the process of developing a new Country Strategy Paper which will inform the next 5 years of programming in country. The country office is at the beginning stages of developing the CSP. In line with practices from other countries the intension is for the strategy paper to further define previously identified programmatically strands. Namely, resilience livelihood and woman’s empowerment both of which will compliment our humanitarian initiatives.
